casebody.data:
H. J. Letterman v. The State. No. 22517. Delivered May 19, 1943.

The opinion states the case.

Eugene F. Mathis, of Lubbock, for appellant. Spurgeon E. Bell, State’s Attorney, of Austin, for the State. BEAUCHAMP, Judge.

The appeal is from a penalty assessed of one year in the county jail for a violation of the liquor laws.

*42Reference is had to cause No. 22,515 against the same appellant, this day decided, for a discussion of the questions presented by the appeal and the conclusion which we reach.

The judgment of the trial court is affirmed.
